body:
This is about `@SelectClasspathResource("/")`, not `@SelectClasspathResource("")` which would already be rejected in `DiscoverySelectors`, wouldn't it?

How did this work before? Cucumber calling `ClasspathResourceSelector.getClasspathResources()` already threw an exception before introducing `DiscoveryIssues`, didn't it?

> This is about @SelectClasspathResource("/"), not @SelectClasspathResource("") which would already be rejected in DiscoverySelectors, wouldn't it?

Ah. My bad. Yes, ` @SelectClasspathResource("") ` would be rejected. And `@SelectClasspathResource("/")` would not be rejected. But the `/` is normalized away when creating the selector.

https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/3c42e165156a92ebd8cda778aafe07873182c3b5/junit-platform-engine/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/engine/discovery/ClasspathResourceSelector.java#L64-L68

> How did this work before? Cucumber calling ClasspathResourceSelector.getClasspathResources() already threw an exception before introducing DiscoveryIssues, didn't it?

Previously Cucumber was not using the `EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver` and did its used its own classpath scanning which didn't make a distinction between scanning packages or classpath resources - it assumed the empty resource meant that the classpath root should be scanned for feature files. I am happy with `@SelectClasspathResource("/")` not being allowed though.

Though the exception thrown is an incidental detail. When using the `EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver` any exception thrown when resolving `DiscoverySelectors.selectClasspathResource("/")` will end up here:


https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/3c42e165156a92ebd8cda778aafe07873182c3b5/junit-platform-launcher/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/launcher/core/DiscoveryIssueCollector.java#L89-L95

And thus cause another exception because the slash is normalized to the empty string, which is not a valid class-path resource name..
